interfaceRec.name: Zone
interfaceRec.description:
The Zones interface must be implemented by all zones.

A zone is a class that defined a region in 2d space. The two required methods make it easy to get a random point within the zone and to find whether a specific point is within the zone. Zones are used to define the start location for particles (in the Position initializer), to define the start velocity for particles (in the Velocity initializer), and to define zones within which the particles die.

method.name: contains
method.description: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone.
method.param: x The x coordinate of the location to test for.
y The y coordinate of the location to test for.
method.return: true if point is inside the zone, false if it is outside.

method.name: getArea
method.description: The getArea method returns the size of the zone. It's used by the MultiZone class to manage the balancing between the different zones.
method.return: the size of the zone.

method.name: getLocation
method.description: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone.
method.return: a random point inside the zone.

classRec.name: DiscZone
classRec.description: The DiscZone zone defines a circular zone. The zone may have a hole in the middle, like a doughnut.

method.name: DiscZone
method.description: The constructor defines a DiscZone zone.
method.param: center The centre of the disc.
outerRadius The radius of the outer edge of the disc.

innerRadius If set, this defines the radius of the inner edge of the disc. Points closer to the center than this inner radius are excluded from the zone. If this parameter is not set then all points inside the outer radius are included in the zone.

method.name: contains
method.description: The contains method determines whether a point is inside the zone. This method is used by the initializers and actions that use the zone. Usually, it need not be called directly by the user.
method.param: x The x coordinate of the location to test for.
y The y coordinate of the location to test for.
method.return: true if point is inside the zone, false if it is outside.

method.name: getArea
method.description: The getArea method returns the size of the zone. This method is used by the MultiZone class. Usually, it need not be called directly by the user.
method.return: a random point inside the zone.

method.name: getLocation
method.description: The getLocation method returns a random point inside the zone. This method is used by the initializers and actions that use the zone. Usually, it need not be called directly by the user.
method.return: a random point inside the zone.

method.description: This method forces the zone to revaluate itself. It should be called whenever the contents of the BitmapData object change. However, it is an intensive method and calling it frequently will likely slow your code down.

classRec.description: The DiscSectorZone zone defines a section of a Disc zone. The disc on which it's based have a hole in the middle, like a doughnut.

method.name: DiscSectorZone
method.description: The constructor defines a DiscSectorZone zone.
method.param: center The centre of the disc.
outerRadius The radius of the outer edge of the disc.

innerRadius If set, this defines the radius of the inner edge of the disc. Points closer to the center than this inner radius are excluded from the zone. If this parameter is not set then all points inside the outer radius are included in the zone.

minAngle The minimum angle, in radians, for points to be included in the zone. An angle of zero is horizontal and to the right. Positive angles are in a clockwise direction (towards the graphical y axis). Angles are converted to a value between 0 and two times PI.

maxAngle The maximum angle, in radians, for points to be included in the zone. An angle of zero is horizontal and to the right. Positive angles are in a clockwise direction (towards the graphical y axis). Angles are converted to a value between 0 and two times PI.

classRec.name: Activity
classRec.description:
The Activity class is the abstract base class for all emitter activities. Instances of the Activity class should not be directly created because the Activity class itself simply defines default methods that do nothing. Classes that extend the Activity class implement their own functionality for the methods they want to use.

An Activity is a class that is used to modify the behaviour of the emitter over time. It may, for example, move or rotate the emitter.

Activities are added to the emitter by using its addActivity method.

method.name: Activity
method.description: The constructor creates an Activity object. But you shouldn't use it because the Activity class is abstract.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.description: The addedToEmitter method is called from the emitter when the Activity is added to it It is called within the emitter's addActivity method and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that the Activity was added to.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.description: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of activities. It is called within the emitter's addActivity method when the user doesn't manually set a priority. It need not be called directly by the user.

method.name: initialize
method.description: The initialize method is used by the emitter to start the activity. It is called within the emitter's start method and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that is using the activity.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the activity. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that is using the activity.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

classRec.name: EmitterImage
classRec.description: The EmitterImage activity draws an image at the point where the emitter is.

method.description: The constructor creates an EmitterImage activity for use by an emitter. To add an EmitterImage to an emitter, use the emitter's addActvity method.
method.param: image The display object to use as the image.

method.name: initialize
method.description: The initialize method is used by the emitter to start the activity. It is called within the emitter's start method and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that is using the activity.

method.name: update

method.param: emitter The Emitter that is using the activity.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: image
method.description: The display object to use as the image.

classRec.description: The MoveEmitter activity moves the emitter at a constant velocity.

method.param: x The x coordinate of the velocity to move the emitter, in pixels per second.
y The y coordinate of the velocity to move the emitter, in pixels per second.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the activity. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that is using the activity.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: x
method.description: The x coordinate of the velocity to move the emitter, in pixels per second

method.name: y
method.description: The y coordinate of the velocity to move the emitter, in pixels per second

classRec.name: RotateEmitter

method.para: angularVelocity The angular velocity for the emitter in radians per second.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the activity. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that is using the activity.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: angularVelocity
method.description: The angular velocity for the emitter in radians per second.

classRec.name: FollowMouse

classRec.name: ParticleCreator
classRec.description: The ParticleCreator is used by the Emitter class tomanage the creation and reuse of particles. To speed up the particle system, the ParticleCreator class maintains a pool of dead particles and reuses them when a new particle is needed, rather than creating a whole ne particle.

method.name: ParticleCreator
method.description: The constructor creates a ParticleCreator object.

method.name: clearAllParticles
method.description: Empties the particle pool.

method.name: createParticle
method.description: To obtain a new Particle object. The createParticle method will return a dead particle from the poll of dead particles or create a new particle if none are available.
method.return: a Particle object.

method.name: disposeParticle
method.description: Returns a particle to the particle pool for reuse
method.param: particle The particle to return for reuse.

classRec.name: Particle
classRec.description:
The Particle class is a set of public properties shared by all particles. It is deliberately lightweight, with only one method. The Initializers and Actions modify these properties directly. This means that the same particles can be used in many different emitters, allowing Particle objects to be shared.
Particles are usually created by the ParticleCreator class. This class just simplifies the reuse of Particle objects which speeds up the application.

method.name: Particle
method.description: Creates a particle. Alternatively particles can be reused by using the ParticleCreator to create and manage them. Usually the emitter will create the particles and the user doesn't need to create them.

method.name: initialize
method.description: Sets the particles properties to their default values.

method.name: colorTransform
method.description: A ColorTransform object that converts white to the colour of the particle.

method.name: dictionary
method.description: The dictionary object enables actions and activities to add additional properties to the particle. Any object adding properties to the particle should use a reference to itself as the dictionary key, thus ensuring it doesn't clash with other object's properties. If multiple properties are needed, the dictionary value can be an object with a number of properties.

method.name: matrixTransform
method.description: A transformation matrix for the position, scale and rotation of the particle.

field.name: age
field.description: The age of the particle, in seconds.

field.name: angVelocity
field.description: The angular velocity of the particle in radians per second.

field.name: color
field.description: The 32bit ARGB color of the particle. The initial value is 0xFFFFFFFF (white).

field.name: image
field.description: The DisplayObject used to display the image.

field.name: isDead
field.description: Whether the particle is dead and should be removed from the stage.

field.name: lifetime
field.description: The lifetime of the particle, in seconds.

field.name: rotation
field.description: The rotation of the particle in radians.

field.name: scale
field.description: The scale of the particle ( 1 is normal size ).

field.name: spaceSortX
field.description: The position in the emitter's horizontal spacial sorted array

field.name: velX
field.description: The x coordinate of the velocity of the particle in pixels per second.

field.name: velY
field.description: The y coordinate of the velocity of the particle in pixels per second.

field.name: x
field.description: The x coordinate of the particle in pixels.

field.name: y
field.description: The y coordinate of the particle in pixels.

classRec.name: Action
classRec.description:
The Action class is the abstract base class for all particle actions. Instances of the Action class should not be directly created because the Action class itself simply defines default methods that do nothing. Classes that extend the Action class implement their own functionality for the methods they want to use.

An Action is a class that is used to modify an aspect of a particle every frame. Actions may, for example, move the particle of modify its velocity.

Actions are added to all particles created by an emitter by using the emitter's addAction method.

method.name: Action
method.description: The constructor creates an Action object. But you shouldn't use it because the Action class is abstract.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.description: The addedToEmitter method is called by the emitter when the Action is added to it It is called within the emitter's addAction method and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that the Action was added to.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.description: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions. It is called within the emitter's addAction method when the user doesn't manually set a priority. It need not be called directly by the user.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be updated.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

classRec.name: SpeedLimit
classRec.description: The SpeedLimit action limits the particle's maximum speed to the specified speed. The behaviour can be switched to instead limit the minimum speed to the specified speed.

method.name: SpeedLimit
method.description: The constructor creates a SpeedLimit action for use by an emitter. To add a SpeedLimit to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: speed The speed limit for the action in pixels per second.
isMinimum If true, particles travelling slower than the speed limit are accelerated to the speed limit, otherwise particles travelling faster than the speed limit are decelerated to the speed limit.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.description: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of actions. It is called within the emitter's addAction method when the user doesn't manually set a priority. It need not be called directly by the user.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be updated.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: isMinimum
method.description: Whether the speed is a minimum (true) or maximum (false) speed.

method.name: limit
method.description: The speed limit

classRec.name: Friction
classRec.description: The Friction action applies friction to the particle to slow it down when it's moving. The frictional force is constant, irrespective of how fast the particle is moving. For forces proportional to the particle's velocity, use one of the drag effects - LinearDrag and QuadraticDrag.

method.name: Friction
method.description: The constructor creates a Friction action for use by an emitter. To add a Friction to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: friction The amount of friction. A higher number produces a stronger frictional force.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be updated.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: friction
method.description: The amount of friction. A higher number produces a stronger frictional force.

method.description: The constructor creates a ColorChange action for use by an emitter. To add a ColorChange to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: startColor The 32bit (ARGB) color of the particle at the beginning of its life.
endColor The 32bit (ARGB) color of the particle at the end of its life.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be updated.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: endColor

method.name: startColor
method.description: The color of the particle at the beginning of its life.

classRec.name: RotationalQuadraticDrag
classRec.description: The RotationalQuadraticDrag action applies drag to the particle to slow it down when it's rotating. The drag force is proportional to the square of the angular velocity of the particle.

method.name: RotationalQuadraticDrag
method.description: The constructor creates a RotationalQuadraticDrag action for use by an emitter. To add a RotationalQuadraticDrag to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: drag The amount of drag. A higher number produces a stronger drag force.

method.name: update
method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be updated.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.name: drag
method.description: The amount of drag. A higher number produces a stronger drag force.

classRec.name: TurnTowardsPoint
classRec.description: The TurnTowardsPoint action causes the particle to constantly adjust its direction so that it travels towards a particular point.

method.name: TurnTowardsPoint
method.description: The constructor creates a TurnTowardsPoint action for use by an emitter. To add a TurnTowardsPoint to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.

classRec.name: Explosion
classRec.description: The Explosion action applies a force on the particle to push it away from a single point - the center of the explosion. The force applied is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the particle to the point.

method.name: Explosion
method.description: The constructor creates an Explosion action for use by an emitter. To add an Explosion to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: power The strength of the force - larger numbers produce a stronger force.
x The x coordinate of the point towards which the force draws the particles.
y The y coordinate of the point towards which the force draws the particles.

epsilon The minimum distance for which the explosion force is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience the explosion as it they were this distance away. This stops the explosion effect blowing up as distances get small.

classRec.name: MouseGravity
classRec.description: The MouseGravity action applies a force on the particle to draw it towards the mouse. The force applied is inversely proportional to the square of the distance from the particle to the mouse.

method.name: MouseGravity
method.description: The constructor creates a MouseGravity action for use by an emitter. To add a MouseGravity to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: power The strength of the force - larger numbers produce a stringer force.

epsilon The minimum distance for which gravity is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience a gravity force as it they were this distance away. This stops the gravity effect blowing up as distances get small. For realistic gravity effects you will want a small epsilon ( ~1 ), but for stable visual effects a larger epsilon (~100) is often better.

method.name: power
method.description: The strength of the gravity force.

classRec.name: Age
classRec.description:
The Age action operates in conjunction with the Lifetime initializer. The Lifetime initializer sets the lifetime for the particle. The Age action then ages the particle over time, altering its energy to reflect its age. This energy can then be used by actions like Fade and ColorChange to alter the appearence of the particle as it ages.

When the particle's lifetime is over, this action marks it as dead.

When adjusting the energy this action can use any of the eassing functions in the org.flintparticles.energy package.

method.name: Age
method.description: The constructor creates an Age action for use by an emitter. To add an Age to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addAction method.
method.param: easing an easing function to use to modify the energy curve over the lifetime of the particle. The default null produces a linear response with no easing.

method.description: The update method is used by the emitter to apply the action to every particle. It is called within the emitter's update loop and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be updated.
time The duration of the frame - used for time based updates.

method.description: The minimum distance for which the explosion force is calculated. Particles closer than this distance experience the explosion as it they were this distance away. This stops the explosion effect blowing up as distances get small.

method.name: power
method.description: The strength of the explosive force.

classRec.name: Initializer
classRec.description:
The Initializer class is the abstract base class for all particle initializers. Instances of the Initializer class should not be directly created because the Initializer class itself simply defines default methods that do nothing. Classes that extend the Initializer class implement their own functionality for the methods they want to use. The Initializer interface must be implemented by all particle initializers.

An Initializer is a class that is used to set an aspect of a particle when it is created. Initializers may, for example, set an initial velocity for a particle.

Initializers are added to all particles created by an emitter by using the emitter's addInitializer method.

method.name: Initializer
method.description: The constructor creates an Initializer object. But you shouldn't use it because the Initializer class is abstract.

method.name: addedToEmitter
method.description: The addedToEmitter method is called from the emitter when the Initializer is added to it It is called within the emitter's addInitializer method and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that the Initializer was added to.

method.name: getDefaultPriority
method.description: The getDefaultPriority method is used to order the execution of initializers. It is called within the emitter's addInitializer method when the user doesn't manually set a priority. It need not be called directly by the user.

method.name: initialize
method.description: The initialize method is used by the emitter to initialize the particle. It is called within the emitter's createParticle method and need not be called by the user.
method.param: emitter The Emitter that created the particle.
particle The particle to be initialized.

classRec.name: Rotation
classRec.description: The Rotation Initializer sets the rotation of the particle.

method.name: Rotation
method.description:
The constructor creates a Rotation initializer for use by an emitter. To add a Rotation to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addInitializer method.

The rotation of particles initialized by this class will be a random value between the minimum and maximum values set. If no maximum value is set, the minimum value is used with no variation.
method.param: minAngle The minimum angle, in radians, for the particle's rotation.
maxAngle The maximum angle, in radians, for the particle's rotation.

color2 the 32bit (ARGB) color at the other end of the color range to use.

classRec.name: Position
classRec.description:
The Position Initializer sets the initial location of the particle.

The class uses zones to place the particle. A zone defines an area of the stage and the particle is placed at a random point within that area. For precise placement, the Point zone defines a single point at which all particles will be placed. Various zones (and the Zones interface for use when implementing custom zones) are defined in the org.flintparticles.zones package.

method.description: The constructor creates a Position initializer for use by an emitter. To add a Position to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addInitializer method.
method.param: zone The zone to place all particles in.

method.description: The constructor creates a ImageClasses initializer for use by an emitter. To add a ImageClasses to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addInitializer method.

parameters the parameters to use when calling the image class constructors. Each entry in this array is an array of parameters. A null entry indicates that no parameters are required. A null value for the parameters array indicates that none of the image classes require parameters.
ratios The weighting to apply to each displayObject. If no weighting values are passed, the images are used with equal probability.

classRec.name: SharedImages
classRec.description:
The SharedImages Initializer sets the DisplayObject to use to draw the particle. It selects one of multiple images that are passed to it. It is used with the BitmapEmitter. When using the DisplayObjectEmitter the ImageClass Initializer must be used.
With the BitmapEmitter, the DisplayObject is copied into the bitmap using the particle's property to place the image correctly. So many particles can share the same DisplayObject because it is only indirectly used to display the particle.

classRec.name: Velocity
classRec.description:
The ColorInit Initializer sets the velocity of the particle. It is usually combined with the Move action to move the particle using this velocity.

The initial velocity is defined using a zone from the org.flintparticles.zones package. The use of zones enables diverse ranges of velocities. For example, to use a specific velocity, a Point zone can be used. To use a varied speed in a specific direction, a LineZone zone can be used. For a fixed speed in a varied direction, a Disc or DiscSector zone with identical inner and outer radius can be used. A Disc or DiscSector with different inner and outer radius produces a range of speeds in a range of directions.

method.description: The constructor creates a Velocity initializer for use by an emitter. To add a Velocity to all particles created by an emitter, use the emitter's addInitializer method.

interfaceRec.name: Counter
interfaceRec.description:
The Counter interface must be implemented by all counters.

A counter is a class that tells an emitter how many particles to emit at any time. The two methods allow the emission of particles when the emitter starts and every frame thereafter.

A counter is set for an emitter using the emitter's setCounter method.

method.name: startEmitter
method.description: The startEmitter method is called when the emitter starts.
method.param: emitter The emitter
method.return: The number of particles the emitter should emit at the moment it starts.

method.name: updateEmitter
method.description: The updateEmitter method is called every frame after the emitter has started.
method.param: emitter The emitter
time The time, in seconds, since the previous call to this method.
method.return: The number of particles the emitter should emit at this time.

classRec.name: Blast
classRec.description: The Blast counter causes the emitter to emit a single burst of particles when it starts and then emit no further particles. It is used, for example, to simulate an explosion.

method.name: Blast
method.description:
The constructor creates a Blast counter for use by an emitter. To add a Blast counter to an emitter use the emitter's setCounter method.

If two parameters are passed to the constructor then a random value between the two is used. This allows for some variation between emitters using the same Blast settings. Otherwise the single value passed in is used.
method.param: startMin The minimum number of particles to emit when the emitter starts.
startMax The maximum number of particles to emit when the emitter starts. If not set then the emitter will emit exactly the startMin number of particles.

method.name: startEmitter
method.description: The startEmitter method is called when the emitter starts.
method.param: emitter The emitter
method.return: The number of particles the emitter should emit at the moment it starts.

method.name: updateEmitter
method.description: The updateEmitter method is called every frame after the emitter has started.
method.param: emitter The emitter
time The time, in seconds, since the previous call to this method.
method.return: The number of particles the emitter should emit at this time.

classRec.name: PerformanceAdjusted
classRec.description: The PerformanceAdjusted counter causes the emitter to emit particles continuously at a steady rate. It then adjusts this rate downwards if the frame rate is below a target frame rate.

method.name: PerformanceAdjusted
method.description: The constructor creates a PerformanceAdjusted counter for use by an emitter. To add a PerformanceAdjusted counter to an emitter use the emitter's setCounter method.
method.param: rateMin The minimum number of particles to emit per second. The counter will never drop the rate below this value.
rateMax The maximum number of particles to emit per second. the counter will start at this rate and adjust downwards if the frame rate is too slow.

targetFrameRate The frame rate that the counter should aim for. Always set this slightly below your actual frame rate since flash will drop frames occasionally even when performance is fine. So, for example, if your movie's frame rate is 30fps and you want to target this rate, set the target rate to 26fps or so.

classRec.name: TimePeriod
classRec.description: The TimePeriod counter causes the emitter to emit particles for a period of time and then stop. The rate of emission over that period can be modified using easing equations thet conform to the interface defined in Robert Penner's easing equations. An update to these equations is included in the org.flintparticles.easing package.

method.param: numParticles The number of particles to emit over the full duration of the time period

easing An easing function used to distribute the emission of the particles over the time period. If no easing function is passed a simple linear distribution is used in which particles are emitted at a constant rate over the time period.

classRec.name: Emitter
classRec.description:
The base class for all particle emitters. The Emitter class extends the Sprite class so it is itself a DisplayObject. Thus, an Emitter is displayed by simply adding it as a child to a DisplayObjectContainer.

At its core, the Emitter class manages the creation and ongoing state of particles. It uses a number of utility classes to customise its behaviour.

An emitter uses Initializers to customise the initial state of particles that it creates. These are added to the emitter using the addInitializer method.

An emitter uses Actions to customise the behaviour of particles that it creates. These are added to the emitter using the addAction method.

An emitter uses Activities to customise its own behaviour, such as its position and rotation.

An emitter uses a Counter to know when and how many particles to emit.

All timings in the emitter are based on actual time passed, not on frames.

The emitter base class does not display the particles it creates. This is usually handled in one of the derived classes like BitmapEmitter and DisplayObjectEmitter.

Most other functionality is est added to an emitter using Actions, Initializers, Activities and Counters. This offers greater flexibility to combine behaviours witout needing to further subclass the Emitter itself.

Event.name: emitterEmpty
Event.description: Dispatched when an emitter contains no particles. Used, for example, to remove an emitter when it contains no particles.

Event.name: particleDead
Event.description: Dispatched when a particle dies and is about to be removed from the system. As soon as the event has been handled the particle will be removed but at the time of the event it still exists so its properties (e.g. its location) can be read from it.

method.name: Emitter
method.description: The constructor creates an emitter. However, it is more common to create one of the subclasses that implements a specific display method.

method.name: addAction
method.description: Adds an Action object to the Emitter. Actions set the behaviour of particles created by the emitter.
method.param: action The Action to add

priority Indicates the sequencing of the actions. Higher numbers cause an action to be run before other actions. All actions have a default priority which is used if no value is passed in this parameter. The default priority is usually the one you want so this parameter is only used when you need to override the default.

method.name: addActivity
method.description: Adds an Activity to the Emitter. Activities set the behaviour of the Emitter.
method.param: activity The activity to add

priority Indicates the sequencing of the activities. Higher numbers cause an activity to be run before other activities. All activities have a default priority which is used if no value is passed in this parameter. The default priority is usually the one you want so this parameter is only used when you need to override the default.

method.name: addInitializer
method.description: Adds an Initializer object to the Emitter. Initializers set the initial properties of particles created by the emitter.
method.param: initializer The Initializer to add

priority Indicates the sequencing of the initializers. Higher numbers cause an initializer to be run before other initialzers. All initializers have a default priority which is used if no value is passed in this parameter. The default priority is usually the one you want so this parameter is only used when you need to override the default.

method.name: cleanUp
method.description: Used in derived classes when they need to do additional tasks when the emitter is disposed of.

method.name: createParticle
method.description: Used internally to create a particle.

method.name: dispose
method.description: Cleans up the emitter prior to removal. This metid is automatically called when the emitter is removed from the stage.

method.name: frameLoop
method.description: Used internally to update the emitter.

method.name: frameUpdate
method.description: Used internally and in derived classes to update the emitter.
method.param: time The duration, in seconds, of the current frame.

method.name: globalToLocal
method.description: Converts the point object from the Stage (global) coordinates to the emitter's (local) coordinates.
method.param: point An object created with the Point class. The Point object specifies the x and y coordinates as properties.
method.return: A Point object with coordinates relative to the display object.

method.name: localToGlobal
method.description: Converts the point object from the emitter's (local) coordinates to the Stage (global) coordinates.
method.param: point The name or identifier of a point created with the Point class, specifying the x and y coordinates as properties.
method.return: A Point object with coordinates relative to the Stage.

method.name: particleCreated
method.description: Used in derived classes when they need to perform additional actions on a newly created particle.

method.name: particleDestroyed
method.description: Used in derived classes when they need to perform additional actions on a particle that is about to be destroyed.

method.name: pause
method.description: Pauses the emitter.

method.name: removeAction
method.description: Removes an Action object from the Emitter.
method.param: action The Action to remove

method.name: removeActivity
method.description: Removes an Activity object from the Emitter.
method.param: activity The Activity to remove

method.name: removeInitializer
method.description: Removes an Initializer object from the Emitter.
method.param: initializer The Initializer to remove

method.name: render
method.description: Used in derived classes to draw the particles.

method.name: resume
method.description: Resumes the emitter after a pause.

method.name: runAhead
method.description: Makes the emitter skip forwards a period of time with a single update. Used when you want the emitter to look like it's been running for a while.
method.param: time The time, in seconds, to skip ahead.

frameRate The frame rate for calculating the new positions. The emitter will calculate each frame over the time period tp get the new state for the emitter and its particles. A higher frameRate will be more accurate but will take longer to calculate.

method.name: setCounter
method.description: Sets the Counter for the Emitter. The counter defines when and with what frequency the emitter emits particles.
method.param: counter THe counter to use

method.name: start
method.description: Starts the emitter. Until start is called, the emitter will not emit any particles.

method.name: particles
method.description: Returns the array of all particles created by this emitter.

method.name: rotRadians
method.description: Indicates the rotation of the Emitter, in radians, from its original orientation.

method.name: rotation
method.description: Indicates the rotation of the Emitter, in degrees, from its original orientation.

method.name: x
method.description: Indicates the x coordinate of the Emitter instance relative to the local coordinates of the parent DisplayObjectContainer.

method.name: y
method.description: Indicates the y coordinate of the Emitter instance relative to the local coordinates of the parent DisplayObjectContainer.

field.name: spaceSort
field.description: Identifies whether the particles should be arranged into spacially sorted arrays - this speeds up proximity testing for those actions that need it

field.name: spaceSortedX
field.description: The array of particle indices sorted based on the paricles horizontal position. To persuade the emitter to create this array you should set the spaceSort property to true. Usually, actions that need this set to true will do so in their addedToEmitter method.

classRec.name: BitmapEmitter
classRec.description:
The BitmapEmitter is an emitter that manages its particles by drawing them all onto a single Bitmap display object.

The image to be used for each particle is a DisplayObject, but this DisplayObject is not used directly but is, rather, copied into the bitmap with the various properties of the particle applied. Consequently each each particle may be represented by the same DisplayObject instance and the SharedImage initializer can be used with this emitter.

The BitmapEmitter allows the use of BitmapFilters to modify the appearance of the bitmap. Every frame, under normal circumstances, the Bitmap used to display the particles is wiped clean before all the particles are redrawn. However, if one or more filters aare added to the emitter, the filters are applied to the bitmap instead of wiping it clean. This enables various trail effects by using blur and other filters.

method.name: BitmapEmitter
method.description: The constructor creates a BitmapEmitter. After creation it should be added to the display list of a DisplayObjectContainer to place it on the stage.

method.name: addFilter
method.description: The addFilter method adds a BitmapFilter to the emitter. These filters are applied each frame before the new particle positions are drawn, instead of wiping the display clear. Use of a blur filter, for example, will produce a trail behind each particle as the previous images blur and fade more each frame.

method.name: addedToStage
method.description: Create the correct sized bitmap when the emitter is added to the display list.

method.name: cleanUp
method.description: Used internally. When the Emitter is disposed it calls tis method and we dump the BitmapData object.

method.name: drawParticle
method.description: Used internally here and in derived classes to alter the manner of the particle rendering (e.g. te PixelRenderer just sets a single pixel.

method.name: removeFilter
method.description: Removes a BitmapFilter object from the Emitter.
method.param: filter The BitmapFilter to remove

method.name: render
method.description: Used internally. Applies filters and renders the particle's image onto the bitmap.

method.name: start
method.description: Starts the emitter. Until start is called, the emitter will not emit any particles.

classRec.name: DisplayObjectEmitter
classRec.description:
The DisplayObjectEmitter is an emitter that manages its particles by adding them to its display list and letting the flash renderer deal will displaying them.

Consequently particle must be represented by a DisplayObject, and each must use a different DisplayObject instance. The DisplayObject to be used should not be defined using the SharedImage initializer because this shares one DisplayObject instance between all the particles. The ImageClass initializer is commonly used because this creates a new DisplayObject for each particle.

method.name: DisplayObjectEmitter
method.description: The constructor creates a DisplayObjectEmitter. After creation it should be added to the display list of a DisplayObjectContainer to place it on the stage.

method.name: particleCreated
method.description: Used internally. When created, the particle is added to the emitter's display list.

method.name: particleDestroyed
method.description: Used internally. When destroyed, the particle is removed from the emitter's display list.

method.name: render
method.description: Used internally. During the update phase, the particle's properties are copied to the DisplayObject representing the particle.

method.name: PixelEmitter
method.description: The constructor creates a PixelEmitter. After creation it should be added to the display list of a DisplayObjectContainer to place it on the stage.

method.name: drawParticle
method.description: Used internally to draw the particles.
